case_title: Filter Pakistan (Pvt.) Limited, Karachi vs Commissioner Inland Revenue, Zone-I, MTO, Karachi
reference_no_or_id: MA (Stay-Ext) No. 969/KB of 2022 in I.T.A. No. 345/KB of 2021
respondant: Commissioner Inland Revenue, Zone-I, MTO, Karachi
complaint_summary: The appellant requested an extension of stay against the recovery of tax demand, citing undue hardship and irreparable loss if not granted.
investigation_summary: The Tribunal reviewed prior stay orders totaling 360 days and examined the provisions of Section 131(5) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001, along with relevant case law and judgments.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal granted an extension of stay until the disposal of the main appeal, citing special circumstances and undue hardship to the appellant.
Decision_or_verdict: Stay granted until disposal of the main appeal.
legal_arguments: Section 131(5) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001 is directory and not mandatory.
Tribunal empowered to grant stay beyond 180 days.
Judgments cited: 2016 PTD 1702 (Islamabad High Court), unreported cases MA(Stay) Ext. No.726/KB/2017, MA(Stay) No.1242/KB/2018, etc.
key_issues: Extension of stay against tax recovery
Applicability of Section 131(5) of Income Tax Ordinance, 2001
Tribunal's authority to grant stay beyond 180 days

legal_terms.Stay Order: A temporary suspension of a legal obligation or enforcement.
legal_terms.Undue Hardship: Excessive difficulty or suffering caused by legal enforcement.

words_and_phrases.Irreparable Loss: Damage or harm that cannot be rectified or compensated.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a stay application filed by Filter Pakistan (Pvt.) Limited against tax recovery demands. The Tribunal extended the stay until the disposal of the main appeal, citing undue hardship and special circumstances. Relevant statutes and case laws were reviewed, including Section 131(5) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001 and judgments from Islamabad High Court and Lahore High Court.

appellant.contention: Tribunal is empowered to grant stay for more than 180 days.
appellant.claim: Irreparable loss if stay is not granted.

legal_analysis: Judgment of Islamabad High Court (2016 PTD 1702) considered.
Judgment of Lahore High Court in Omega Industries case referenced.
tribunal_findings.decision: Stay granted till disposal of main appeal.

additional_notes.temporary_relief: Granted to appellant due to undue hardship.
